qas.question: What were the major issues that needed to be addressed?

qas.question: What were the major issues that needed to be revised?
What caused a need for more industry?

context: In the U.S., a push for revisions of the <a1_0><a5_0><b9_0>FD&C<b9_0/><a5_0/><a1_0/> Act emerged from Congressional hearings led by <a0_0><a6_0><b8_0>Senator Estes Kefauver<b8_0/><a6_0/><a0_0/> of Tennessee in <a4_0><b12_0>1959<b12_0/><a4_0/>. The hearings covered a wide range of policy issues, including <a2_0><b10_0>advertising abuses, questionable efficacy of drugs, and the need for <a7_0>greater<a7_0/> regulation of the industry<b10_0/><a2_0/>. While momentum for new legislation temporarily flagged under extended debate, <a3_0><b11_0>a new tragedy emerged<b11_0/><a3_0/> that underscored the need for more comprehensive regulation and provided the driving force for the passage of new laws.
